meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or having the form of an ellipse.
meanings.sent1: The moon follows an elliptic path around the Earth.
meanings.sent2: The artist drew an elliptic shape for the spaceship in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The elliptic orbit of the comet made it look like it was dancing in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her elliptic handwriting was elegant and flowing, like a graceful dance on paper.
meanings.sent5: The elliptic design of the garden maze confused the visitors but delighted them with its beauty.

meanings.sent1: The elliptic message left out important details.
meanings.sent2: His elliptic speech made it hard to understand his true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The elliptic plot of the movie kept the audience guessing until the very end.
meanings.sent4: Her elliptic explanation left everyone puzzled, trying to fill in the missing pieces.
meanings.sent5: The elliptic novel was full of gaps that allowed the reader's imagination to run wild.
